title: Not able to use existing database sqlite
body:
Thank you for submitting an issue. Please refer to our [issue policy](https://www.github.com/mlflow/mlflow/blob/master/ISSUE_POLICY.md) for additional information about bug reports. For help with debugging your code, please refer to [Stack Overflow](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/mlflow).

**Please fill in this bug report template to ensure a timely and thorough response.**

### Willingness to contribute
The MLflow Community encourages bug-fix contributions. Would you or another member of your organization be willing to contribute a fix for this bug to the MLflow code base? Yes

- [ ] Yes. I would be willing to contribute a fix for this bug with guidance from the MLflow community.

### System information
- **Have I written custom code (as opposed to using a stock example script provided in MLflow)**: Yes
- **OS Platform and Distribution (e.g., Linux Ubuntu 16.04)**:  Linux
- **MLflow installed from (source or binary)**: Source
- **MLflow version (run ``mlflow --version``)**: 1.7.2
- **Python version**: 3.8
- **npm version, if running the dev UI**:
- **Exact command to reproduce**:  docker-compose up --build

### Describe the problem
Describe the problem clearly here. Include descriptions of the expected behavior and the actual behavior.

### Code to reproduce the issue
Not able to serve the existing DB that has previous metrics 

### Other info / logs

tracking-server_1  | 2021/07/07 20:50:35 ERROR mlflow.cli: Error initializing 
tracking-server_1  | 2021/07/07 20:50:35 ERROR mlflow.cli: Detected out-of-dattabase, then run 'mlflow db upgrade <database_uri>' to migrate your database tatabase's documentation for more detail.
tracking-server_1  | Traceback (most recent call last):
tracking-server_1  |   File "/opt/conda/lib/python3.8/site-packages/mlflow/cli
tracking-server_1  |     initialize_backend_stores(backend_store_uri, default_
tracking-server_1  |   File "/opt/conda/lib/python3.8/site-packages/mlflow/ser
tracking-server_1  |     return builder(store_uri=store_uri, artifact_uri=artifact_uri)
tracking-server_1  |   File "/opt/conda/lib/python3.8/site-packages/mlflow/server/handlers.py", line 101, in _get_sqlalchemy_store
tracking-server_1  |     return SqlAlchemyStore(store_uri, artifact_uri)
tracking-server_1  |   File "/opt/conda/lib/python3.8/site-packages/mlflow/store/tracking/sqlalchemy_store.py", line 125, in __init__
tracking-server_1  |     mlflow.store.db.utils._verify_schema(self.engine)
tracking-server_1  |   File "/opt/conda/lib/python3.8/site-packages/mlflow/store/db/utils.py", line 54, in _verify_schema
tracking-server_1  |     raise MlflowException(
tracking-server_1  | mlflow.exceptions.MlflowException: Detected out-of-date database schema (found version 0a8213491aaa, but expected c48cb773bb87). Take a backup of your database, then run 'mlflow db upgrade <database_uri>' to migrate your database to the latest schema. NOTE: schema migration may result in database downtime - please consult your database's documentation for more detail.
customer_data_segmentation_mlops_dvc_tracking-server_1 exited with code 1


### What component(s), interfaces, languages, and integrations does this bug affect?
Components 
- [ ] `area/server-infra`: MLflow server, JavaScript dev server
- [ ] `area/tracking`: Tracking Service, tracking client APIs, autologging

Interface 
- [ ] `area/docker`: Docker use across MLflow's components, such as MLflow Projects and MLflow Models
- [ ] `area/sqlalchemy`: Use of SQLAlchemy in the Tracking Service or Model Registry
